question_stem: Q3. The coefficient table from the summary output of model M2 and model M3 will be the same. True or False?
question_stem_html: Q3. The coefficient table from the summary output of model M2 and model M3 will be the same. True or False?

choices.explanation:
ANS: TRUE
The R code in line 16 has declared with R that column “color” inside data frame “crab” is categorical, hence, when fitting M3 with “data = crab” in line 18, R will have 3 coefficients for color. 
It’s recommended to fit a linear model as M3.

items.solution:
ANS: TRUE
The R code in line 16 has declared with R that column “color” inside data frame “crab” is categorical, hence, when fitting M3 with “data = crab” in line 18, R will have 3 coefficients for color. 
It’s recommended to fit a linear model as M3.
items.solution_html:
ANS: TRUE
The R code in line 16 has declared with R that column “color” inside data frame “crab” is categorical, hence, when fitting M3 with “data = crab” in line 18, R will have 3 coefficients for color. 
It’s recommended to fit a linear model as M3.
